introSection.title: A Nature-Based Drop-Off Program Guided by Respectful Parenting & Outdoor Learning
paragraphs: Welcome to Placer Forest School — a forest school nestled in Placer County, offering child-led, nature-based learning for children ages 4 to 12 years old. Located conveniently for families in Rocklin, Lincoln, Loomis, and Roseville, CA, our program meets Fridays in a local open space rich with boulders, trees, and creeks, providing an ideal environment for exploration, movement, and discovery. (Exact location is shared upon registration for privacy and safety.)

Our school philosophy draws inspiration from leading educators and researchers in the fields of child development, nature-based learning, and respectful parenting. You can explore these influential voices and their work in our resources section.
We fill a vital need in the Lincoln, Roseville, Loomis, and Rocklin area: a developmentally aligned drop-off program where children can:

benefits.text: Social-Emotional Growth – child-led games and group activities that build cooperation, confidence, and authentic peer connections.
Nature-Inspired Art & Science – hands-on projects using natural materials and real-world discoveries to spark creativity and curiosity.
Physical Strength & Coordination – active movement and play across varied outdoor terrain to develop agility, balance, and resilience.
Connection with Nature & Each Other – long-term, regular sessions that nurture deep relationships and a true sense of belonging to the natural world and community.
Self-Directed Play & Exploration – honoring children’s innate need for play as a source of therapy, self-expression, and joyful learning.

quotes.text: Nature-deficit disorder is a phrase I coined to describe the human costs of alienation from nature, among them: diminished use of the senses, attention difficulties, and higher rates of physical and emotional illnesses.
quotes.author: Richard Louv, Last Child in the Woods

quotes.text: The outdoors is a child’s ‘classroom’ where they learn how to problem-solve, be creative, and develop perseverance.
quotes.author: Angela Hanscom, Balanced and Barefoot

quotes.text: If we love our children and want them to thrive, we must allow them more time and opportunity to play, not less.
quotes.author: Dr. Peter Gray

missionSection.title: 🌱 Mission Statement
missionSection.content: At Placer Forest School, our mission is to create a respectful, nature-rich learning environment where children ages 4 to 12 years old are free to explore, connect, and grow. Rooted in the principles of respectful parenting, child-led discovery, and unstructured outdoor play, we offer families in Placer County—including Lincoln, Roseville, Loomis, and Rocklin—a forest school experience that supports whole-child development, fosters community, and honors the wonder of childhood.
